abstract: Citigroup said Richard Stuckey, named in January 2009 to oversee $241 billion of the bank’s most troubled mortgages and bonds, would retire later this year after cutting the toxic asset pool nearly in half.
snippet: Citigroup said Richard Stuckey, named in January 2009 to oversee $241 billion of the bank’s most troubled mortgages and bonds, would retire later this year after cutting the toxic asset pool nearly in half.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup said Richard A. Stuckey Jr., named in January 2009 to oversee $241 billion of the bank’s most troubled mortgages and bonds, would retire later this year after cutting the toxic assets pool nearly in half, Bloomberg News reports, citing an internal memo.

headline.main: Citi Executive to Retire After Cutting Toxic Assets
